intro: Cyrtandra hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its common name. Cyrtandra hispidissima is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
